title: Augusta County: Jedediah Hotchkiss to Sara A. Hotchkiss, May 31, 1863
summary: Hotchkiss writes to his wife, describing personnel changes in the Army after the Battle of Chancellorsville. Hotchkiss does not anticipate being able to go home soon, but comments on affairs at home.
keywords: Church/Religious Activity, Women, Military Strategy, Military Authority, Family, Desertion/Leave, Home Front, Slavery, African Americans, American Civil War
